meanings.definition: Somewhat broad in size or extent.
meanings.sent1: The road was broadish, allowing many cars to pass through.
meanings.sent2: She wore a broadish hat to shield herself from the sun.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to squeeze through the broadish gap in the fence but got stuck.
meanings.sent4: His broadish smile lit up the room, making everyone feel welcome.
meanings.sent5: The broadish river flowed gently through the valley, reflecting the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Having a broad or wide appearance.
meanings.sent1: The broadish tree provided ample shade on hot days.
meanings.sent2: The broadish shoulders of the football player made him stand out on the field.
meanings.sent3: The broadish painting seemed to stretch beyond the canvas, almost coming to life.
meanings.sent4: Her broadish knowledge of history impressed the professor.
meanings.sent5: The broadish smile on her face showed genuine happiness and contentment.
